title: Chapter 167
content: # Chapter 167 Twenty-four seconds earlier. *Damn.* Grid's muscles locked as Hell Gao conjured dozens of black spheres from nothing. Each one radiated heat that blistered the air. Could he survive a barrage where every impact dealt 3,700 to 4,200 damage? *Twenty-nine, thirty.* His eyes tracked the forming orbs. *He's not actually going to launch them all at once, is he?* Hell Gao's flames were fast. Explosive. If thirty spheres came at him simultaneously, dodging was a fantasy. Blocking them all? Even less likely. *Worst case scenario, I burn the invincible passive.* Grid abandoned his defensive stance. His grip shifted on Failure's hilt. *They say a crisis is an opportunity.* **Pepepepeng!** He focused on the thirty fireballs hovering in the air. Beyond the flames, Hell Gao's face twisted into something between monster and man. A thick, cruel smile stretched across those bizarre features. *That bastard thinks he's already won.* Grid had survived enough battles to recognize overconfidence. The moment before victory was when guards dropped. When weakness showed. *If the passive can't save me, then defending is pointless. Better to hit back.* He'd faced knight Leo of Winston back when he was weak and pathetic. During his mid-levels, Malacus and the Guardian of the Labyrinth. After that came Shay's party, the Pope, the Awakened Guardian, Neberius. Different enemies. Same lesson. *I have to eat some damage.* **Pepepeng!** Grid hurled Kenen's darts. The belt generated random effects. Fog, poison fog, or explosion. He needed the first. Vision had to go. Gray mist bloomed across the chamber. *Yes.* He barked a command at the pavranium. *Protect me as much as you can.* The seven golden blades shot into motion. They formed a rotating barrier as thirty black fireballs punched through the fog. **Kwa kwa kwa kwang!** The blades moved with inhuman precision, but thirty targets was too many. Gaps appeared. Fireballs slipped through. They slammed into Grid's armor like hammers made of hate. **Kwa kwa kwa kwang!** > [You have suffered 3,870 damage.] > [You have suffered 3,920 damage.] > [You have been hit by a lethal blow!] > [You have suffered 8,100 damage.] "Ugh!" Grid raised the Divine Shield to catch the worst of it, but the shielded areas were limited. His health plummeted. He fumbled a potion from his inventory and chugged it while yanking the Hooded Zip Up over his armor. **Suuuk.** The cloak activated. Kruger's legendary craftsmanship reproduced perfectly. As explosions rippled across the chamber, Grid's body vanished from sight. "Kuahahaha! That cockroach has finally been turned to ash!" Hell Gao's laughter echoed off stone walls. Grid equipped the Ideal Dagger. Quick Movements kicked in. His legs pumped as he sprinted toward the demon at inhuman speed. Hell Gao had been weakened twice now. His detection ability was a shadow of what it had been. > [You have been detected by Hell Gao, the Master of Hellfire.] > [Stealth has been turned off.] Hell Gao's head snapped around when Grid closed to three meters. The invisibility shattered. "What!?" "Pagma's Swordsmanship." Grid had already summoned the red lightning. It coiled around Failure's blade like a serpent. Blacksmith's Rage flooded his veins with chemical fire. He drove the greatsword toward Hell Gao's chest and called his strongest technique. "Kill!" **Puoook!** > [Critical!] > [You have dealt 538,000 damage to the target.] Red lightning, Blacksmith's Rage, and the +9 Failure combined into overwhelming violence. Hell Gao's health gauge dropped from seven-tenths to half. But Grid's jaw tightened. Neither 5 Joint Attacks from the Holy Light Gloves nor from Failure had triggered. *If both had activated. Ten strikes total. He'd be dead.* No point dwelling on it. Grid had closed the distance. That was the victory that mattered. "Cough! You bastard!" Hell Gao's face went rigid. Blood the color of tar leaked from his chest. The demon finally understood danger. **Chwaack!** Grid twisted Failure deeper into Hell Gao's sternum. "Now it's your turn." Every skill except Transcended Link had cycled off cooldown. Kill was spent, but Link remained ready. "Pagma's Swordsmanship, Link!" **Pipit! Pipipipipit!** Grid's body moved through the forms with practiced ease. Dozens of energy blades materialized in the air. > [The level of Pagma's Swordsmanship, Link has increased.] > [Your damage will increase. The number of times a target is hit will increase by 5 times.] > **[Link Lv. 3]** > > *A dazzling sword dance like butterfly wings.* > > Deals 1,100% of your attack power to a single target. > > **Skill Usage Conditions:** Sword-type weapon equipped. > > **Skill Mana Cost:** 500 > > **Skill Cooldown Time:** 100 seconds Five months since the Pope's death. Hundreds of uses. Finally, the level had risen. Grid's lips pulled back in a feral grin. Hell Gao's face twisted into something uglier than before. "Kuaaaack!" > [You have dealt 154,600 damage to the target.] Hell Gao had been weakened twice, but 150,000 damage wasn't a killing blow. The demon recovered his balance and sprayed flames wildly across the chamber. Grid pressed forward. "Where are you aiming?" He closed the gap until Hell Gao's flames couldn't track him properly. Pagma's Swordsmanship, Wave, swept out in a circle. The energy canceled Hell Gao's fire. Grid followed with Restraint. Three seconds of helplessness locked the demon in place. *Looking back, Transcended Link only became possible after Link reached level 2.* Grid's mind raced. He stepped toward Hell Gao's shrinking form and prepared two skills in rapid sequence. *Now that Link is level 3, can I combine it with something else?* Worth testing. Kill seemed the most promising fusion target. If that failed, he'd try Wave. "Pagma's Swordsmanship!" Grid began the sword dance. Killing intent gathered at Failure's tip like a physical weight. Hell Gao broke free from Restraint's influence. Flame coalesced in his left hand. Hot wind in his right. The demon merged both forces together. *Can't take that hit again.* Hell Gao fired the combined attack in a straight line. **Kwa kwa kwa kwang!** The ground charred black. A whirlwind of flames roared toward Grid. Grid's dance reached its conclusion. "Kill, Link." If the fusion failed, Grid's remaining health would drain to zero. The invincible passive would trigger. *Please.* Less than a second. Grid prayed for success. Hell Gao prayed for death. **Kwajak!** Failure collided with the flame whirlwind. The fires didn't consume the blade. They were drawn into it. The greatsword's light intensified until it burned brighter than Hell Gao's flames. *Yes!* > [The new skill fusion has succeeded.] > [Fusion skill 'Linked Kill' has been created.] > [Your Intelligence has increased by 10 due to the successful fusion of a new skill.] > **[Linked Kill]** > > *A sword dance combining hatred with the dazzling flapping of wings.* > > *Due to the weight of Kill, the dazzling style is reduced, but the strength of Kill is overpowering.* > > Generates a minimum of 3 to 7 random blows dealing 1,500% damage per hit (current Kill damage minus 300%). > > * This skill does not share cooldown with Kill and Link. > * **Warning:** Stamina will be fully depleted if 7 strikes occur. > > **Skill Mana Consumption:** 90% of maximum mana > > **Skill Cooldown Time:** 1 hour The power of Kill, slightly reduced. Not as devastating as Kill plus 5 Joint Attacks, but the advantage was clear. Three strikes guaranteed. No relying on RNG. **Duguen! Duguen!** Grid's heart hammered against his ribs. The first Linked Kill strike crushed through the fire whirlwind's power. **Jjejeong!** *He still has this much left?* Grid was clearly injured. Blood seeped from burns beneath his armor. Yet he continued to unleash devastating attacks. Hell Gao's confusion was palpable. *Is he even human?* Such tenacious vitality. Grid truly resembled Muller. Hell Gao was forced to acknowledge this as the blue greatsword penetrated the remnants of flames. > [You have suffered 215,000 damage.] Second blow. > [You have suffered 219,800 damage.] Third blow. > [You have suffered 214,600 damage.] Fourth blow. > [You have suffered 220,100 damage.] Fifth blow. > [You have suffered 218,700 damage.] Sixth blow. > [You have suffered 219,200 damage.] The end? No. Like a restaurant on opening day offering ridiculous service, Grid received a bonus for his successful fusion. > [Failure's option effect is activated, causing the skill '5 Joint Attacks' to be generated.] Notification windows erupted across Grid's vision as he struck Hell Gao. > [You have dealt 1,057,300 damage to the target.] > [Failure's option effect is activated, causing the skill '5 Joint Attacks' to be generated.] > [Critical!] > [You have dealt 2,230,900 damage to the target.] "...!" Hell Gao couldn't even scream. The black flames wreathing his body shifted to jade, then extinguished completely. Grid's strongest skill combined with his strongest item's option drove Hell Gao toward death in an instant. Grid looked down at the kneeling demon. "I am in the same class as Muller." **Pisik.** Hell Gao nodded for the first time. "I admit it." He had watched this human called Grid grow during their battle. Eventually, Grid would follow Muller's path. "I lost. I will postpone my purpose of consuming human souls to increase my strength." Hell Gao admitted defeat. The demonkin's body disintegrated into fog. **Pepeng! Pepepeng!** The two unmined fire stones exploded as Hell Gao vanished. Peak Sword jerked upright. "The fire stones?" He'd been so absorbed watching the battle that mining had slipped his mind completely. Grid was focused on notification windows and didn't notice. > [You have defeated Hell Gao, the Master of Hellfire, who seizes human souls.] > [Memphis' Egg has been acquired.] > [118,411,132 experience has been acquired.] > [Your level has risen.] > [Your level has risen.] > [Your level has risen.] > [Your level has risen.] > [Your level has risen.] > [Your level has...] Eleven levels at once. Grid reached level 253. That put him comparable to the top 300 rankers, though still the lowest in the Tzedakah Guild. And the reward was some strange egg. Peak Sword approached cautiously. "In the end, only two fire stones were mined. That's serious damage." Hell Gao had been the most powerful boss Grid had ever faced. The rewards felt inadequate for the effort invested. He collapsed onto the stone floor. His stamina was completely depleted. Even lifting a finger seemed impossible. Peak Sword jogged over. "Are you okay?" Grid's frown deepened into a scowl. "Am I okay? What will you do if I'm not okay? Give me the fire stone you mined?" Peak Sword's response came without hesitation. "Of course." He pulled out the fire stone. The mineral glowed with internal heat. "I'll give this to you." Fire stones were so valuable that pricing them was nearly impossible. But Peak Sword's life and ranking had been saved by Grid. This was gratitude made tangible. Grid grabbed the fire stone and muttered under his breath. "I need one more. I tied Hell Gao up for ten minutes. How did you only get one fire stone in that time? Your level isn't good enough. Pretty pathetic." "..." Peak Sword was ranked sixteenth on the unified rankings. --- **Glossary of Common Korean Terms** **OG:** Glossary Link **Current schedule:** 20 chapters a week Check out my Patreon for early access to unedited chapters and to help achieve goals for extra chapters.
